paragraphs.text: Ate zero Poptarts.
paragraphs.name: f06b

paragraphs.text: I’m all about ideas, thanks to my wiring. I found a copy of Strengthfinders at a thrift store last year for $3, with the code in tact. I took the test and by a whole lot my #1 strength is ideation.
paragraphs.name: 81a0

paragraphs.text: Ten people I wish I knew and one idea for how I might meet each one.

paragraphs.name: 460f
paragraphs.text: I’m not great with all of the steps between here and there. I take off on the Yellow Brick Road, and I know that Oz is at the end, but I hit a fork in the road and realize that if I do this other thing I can get to Wonderland instead of Oz, and Wonderland sounds awesome. I can totally imagine being there.

7371d430afb2.title: This resonates with me so much!

paragraphs.text: This resonates with me so much! I’m also an ideas person, sometimes to the detriment of actually finishing something. There’s always a new idea bubbling at the surface.
paragraphs.name: b3a3

41f875e3c026.title: Great way to see the value in the 10 ideas exercise from “James!”

paragraphs.text: Great way to see the value in the 10 ideas exercise from “James!” I totally loved it when reading that same post and have “10 Ideas Today” as a permanent appointment on my calendar as a reminder every morning. Helps keep those creative juices flowing. Thanks for jumpstart, Shaunta!
paragraphs.name: b8da

paragraphs.text: Hahaha 🤣 Shaunta, I totally get this because I’m the same. Some people would say this behavior means I lack discipline… I prefer to say that I over indulge my imagination and creativity…

paragraphs.text: Thanks. I knew that, of course. Thanks for pointing out my mistake. It’s fixed. (I’m sure he would find it funny, though.)

b06d51adce53.title: Actually the title was part of an experiment.

paragraphs.text: Actually the title was part of an experiment. Sadly this post got almost zero reads with the title “becoming an idea machine.” The addition of hope to and a swear word made it so that it has more than 5000 reads now.
paragraphs.name: 4b21

paragraphs.text: This is so me. I had a brain fart the other day realising that my constant brain-farting is actually one of my strengths and not a weakness. I just assumed everyone comes up with 3,643 ideas a day. Turns out people actually want to be more creative!
paragraphs.name: a2fc

paragraphs.text: I. Know.

8b9da2667cfb.title: I’ve been doing this informally for as long as I remember.

paragraphs.text: I’ve been doing this informally for as long as I remember. I never stop myself when I have an idea. I force myself to pause, and jot it down in an ideas book. It doesn’t matter if I never look at it again in my life, I have 10+ full notebooks and sketchbooks of ideas. The point is I allowed myself the freedom to imagine something differently, and it…
paragraphs.name: 36a0

a7bbbf0f9737.title: I’ve been doing this on-and-off for a year and my top 3 recommendations are:

paragraphs.text: I’ve been doing this on-and-off for a year and my top 3 recommendations are:
paragraphs.name: cdb1

paragraphs.text: It helps to have a theme for the sets of 10,e.g. stories I want to write on day 1,then ideas about each particular story on subsequent days.
paragraphs.name: cced

paragraphs.text: Sharing is caring,so I post my top 3 business ideas on LinkedIn,stories on my blog…
